    Utilities for customising the display of tables

      • addGraphicToColummnHeader

        public static void addGraphicToColummnHeader(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<?,?> column,
                                             java.lang.String imageURL)
        Add a graphic to a table columnn dynamically. If the graphic is null, do nothing.
        Parameters:
        imageURL - the URL of the image to be added
        column - the column

      • doctorColumnHeaders

        static void doctorColumnHeaders(java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.control.TableView<?>> tableViews)
        replace all column headers in a table with custom headers whose display can be modified. Only do this if the column already has an embedded graphic.
        Parameters:
        tableViews - An ArrayList of the tables whose columns are to be doctored

      • doctorOneColumnHeader

        public static void doctorOneColumnHeader(javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<?,?> column)
        Replace one column header with a custom header whose display can be modified to show graphics
        Parameters:
        column - the column whose header is to be modified

      • switchHeaderDisplays

        public static void switchHeaderDisplays(java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.control.TableView<?>> tables)
        Set all columns in the viewer to display a graphic only, if the graphic has been set. This will only work for those columns which have been 'doctored' using doctorColumnHeaders(). It applies to all doctored tables - individual tables are not(at present) singled out.

        NOTE; the option to display both text and graphics is not available in the enum ViewManager.graphicsState, but we could possibly achieve the effect by 'undoctoring' the column headers.

        Parameters:
        tables - an ArrayList of the tables to be customised
